item.title: Veronica add a quote by David Nicholls
item.description: "She drinks pints of coffee and writes little observations and ideas for stories with her best fountain pen on the linen-white pages of expensive notebooks. Sometimes, when it's going badly, she wonders if what she believes to be a love of the written word is really just a fetish for stationery." -- David Nicholls

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "So, I guess we are who we are for alot of reasons. And maybe we'll never know most of them. But even if we don't have the power to choose where we come from, we can still choose where we go from there. We can still do things. And we can try to feel okay about them." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "Sometimes people use thought to not participate in life." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: "As the playwright George Bernard Shaw once put it: â€œThe reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man." -- Malcolm Gladwell

item.title: Veronica add a quote by Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: "The excessive use of force creates legitimacy problems, and force without legitimacy leads to defiance, not submission." -- Malcolm Gladwell
